s0.content: Lord, I have cheated the weight of my measures at the market—please forgive my dishonesty and teach me integrity.

s1.content: I confess that I only give alms in the temple so others may see me as righteous, not out of love for the poor.

s2.content: Jesus, I denied knowing You when the Roman guards questioned me—have mercy on my cowardice and strengthen my faith.

s3.content: I seek forgiveness, not because I regret mocking the tax collectors, but because I fear Your judgment.

s4.content: Father, I have harbored hatred toward the Samaritans in my heart—cleanse me and help me love as You do.

s5.content: I confess that I sold doves for sacrifice at an unfair price, caring more for profit than for those seeking You.

s6.content: God, I have walked past the beggar at the city gate many times without offering help—soften my hardened heart.

s7.content: I repent, not because I am truly sorrowful for doubting Your miracles, but because I want to be accepted among the believers.

s8.content: Holy One, I have judged the woman caught in adultery, forgetting my own sin—teach me to show mercy as You have shown me.

w.content: Not quite. We shouldn't baptize and forgive those whose motivations are wicked.

cutscene1.0.content: I baptize you with water for repentance. But after me comes one who is more powerful than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry.

cutscene1.1.content: He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire. His winnowing fork is in his band, and he will clear his threshing floor, gathering his wheat into the barn and burning up the chaff with unquenchable fire.

cutscene2.0.content: It is I, Jesus Christ. I have come to be baptized by you, John the Baptist.

cutscene2.1.content: I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?

cutscene2.2.content: Let it be so now; it is proper for us to do this to fulfill all righteousness.

w2.content: I am the Messiah; for what reason do you turn me away?

cutscene2.3.content: This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased.
